thread.title: As distrust grows in Haight, street kids seek to clean up image
thread.title_full: As distrust grows in Haight, street kids seek to clean up image - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Vivian Ho
title: As distrust grows in Haight, street kids seek to clean up image
text:
Photo: Paul Chinn, The Chronicle Maggie May (left) and Davis Wood chat with Christian Calinsky, who helps provide opportunities to the Haight’s young residents through the nonprofit Taking It to the Streets. Maggie May (left) and Davis Wood chat with Christian Calinsky, who...
Just days after Haight-Ashbury residents gathered to angrily decry the transient street kid presence that has been laced into their neighborhood’s identity for decades, self-proclaimed street kids Maggie May and Davis Wood calmly put on bright yellow vests and picked up litter along the street that they too consider home. Maggie May (left) and Davis Wood chat with Christian Calinsky, who helps provide opportunities to the Haight’s young residents through the nonprofit Taking It to the Streets. Maggie May (left) and Davis Wood chat with Christian Calinsky, who...
Just days after Haight-Ashbury residents gathered to angrily decry the transient street kid presence that has been laced into their neighborhood’s identity for decades, self-proclaimed street kids Maggie May and Davis Wood calmly put on bright yellow vests and picked up litter along the street that they too consider home.
